com.escapeindustries.dotmatrix
Class Glyph

java.lang.Object
  com.escapeindustries.dotmatrix.Glyph
Direct Known Subclasses:
Digit, Seperator, Space
public abstract class Glyph
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a thing that can be drawn on a Grid. To implement a Glyph, sub-class it and provide an implementation for draw.

Author:
Mark Roberts

The height in dots needed to draw this Glyph

setGrid

setColumn

public void setColumn(int column)
Set the left-most column of the target Grid that this Glyph will draw at.

Parameters:
column - The left-most column at which to start drawing this Glyph in the target Grid.
See Also:
setGrid

setRow

public void setRow(int row)
Set the top-most column of the target Grid that this Glyph will draw at.

Parameters:
row - The top-most row at which to start drawing this Glyph in the target Grid.

changeDot

public void changeDot(int index,
                      boolean on)
Convenience for setting a dot on or off using a one dimensional index as used as a shape definition by DigitDefinition.

Parameters:
index - One-dimensional zero-based index to the dot. For example, if the dot was the the right-most of the second line of a Glyph with a width of 5, index would be 9.
on - The new state of the dot.

draw

public abstract void draw()
Override this to add code to draw a Glyph into the target Grid. Make calls to changeDot(int, boolean) to set individual dots on or off.
